revised_title: Muscular Varieties of the Human Neck, Shoulder, and Chest
tldr: The author presents a study of various muscular variations in the human neck, shoulder, and chest, focusing on their function, homologies in mammals, and their significance in anatomical science. The study includes observations of 202 dissected subjects and discusses the different types of muscles and their attachments, providing insights into the morphological and teleological aspects of these muscular variations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Anatomy
